value.title: Identify faces and expressions by using the Computer Vision API in Azure Cognitive Services
value.excerpt: Learn about the Computer Vision API in Azure that allows you to identify facial details in pictures.

images.title: Identify faces and expressions by using the Computer Vision API in Azure Cognitive Services

value.title: Instrument server-side web application code with Application Insights
value.excerpt: Obtain comprehensive diagnostic information from a web app by adding the Application Insights SDK to your server-side code.

images.title: Instrument server-side web application code with Application Insights

value.title: Introduction to high-performance computing (HPC) on Azure
value.excerpt: Discover the services available on Azure for your high-performance computing workloads.

images.title: Introduction to high-performance computing (HPC) on Azure

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure IoT Hub and determine scenarios when to use IoT Hub.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub

value.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
value.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Kubernetes. Describe the benefits of container orchestration with features like deployment management, automatic updates, and self-healing.

images.title: Introduction to Kubernetes

value.title: Embrace Zero Trust with Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Learn about the Zero Trust model and how to implement Zero Trust into your organization.

value.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
value.excerpt: Your application requires service passwords, connection strings, and other secret configuration values to do its job. Storing and handling secret values is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of leakage. Azure Key Vault, in combination with managed identities for Azure resources, enables your Azure web app to access secret configuration values easily and securely without needing to store any secrets in your source control or configuration.

images.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault

value.title: Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: This module covers the basics of how to use the Cloud Adoption Framework—a set of documentation, implementation guidance, best practices, and tools that aid in aligning the strategy for business, people, and technology.

images.title: Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure

value.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies
value.excerpt: Learn how to measure the throughput of your NoSQL database and assess the impact of partition key and indexing strategies on throughput.

images.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies

value.title: Monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot your Azure storage
value.excerpt: Discover the tools available to detect and correct problems with your Azure Storage to enable your cloud storage infrastructure to operate at peak performance.

images.title: Monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot your Azure storage

value.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python
value.excerpt: Import airline arrival data into a Jupyter notebook and use Pandas to clean it. Then, build a machine learning model with Scikit-Learn and use Matplotlib to visualize output.

images.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python

value.title: Protect data in-transit and at rest
value.excerpt: Protect data in-transit and at rest

value.title: Query relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn about Structured Query Language (SQL), and how you can use it to query, insert, update, and delete data in a relational database.

images.title: Query relational data in Azure

value.title: React to state changes in your Azure services by using Event Grid
value.excerpt: Build a serverless application architecture, automate your operations, and integrate applications by handling Azure events with Event Grid.

images.title: React to state changes in your Azure services by using Event Grid

value.title: Deploying machine learning models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to register and deploy ML models with the Azure Machine Learning service.

images.title: Deploying machine learning models with Azure Machine Learning

value.title: Create a chat bot to help students learn with Azure Bot Service
value.excerpt: Learn how to build a simple bot called GeoFriend, to help students learn the basics of geography. This module covers the principles of responsible conversational AI and how to make bots that a user can trust and enjoy speaking to. Our bot will help school children to learn more about geography and answer some questions, and also learn some study techniques!

images.title: Create a chat bot to help students learn with Azure Bot Service

value.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
value.excerpt: Define a workflow using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators. Your workflow will run automatically when data is available, process the data in the cloud, record results in a database, and send email notifications.

images.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps

value.title: Run nonfunctional tests in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Run automated load tests by using Apache JMeter, a form of nonfunctional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Run nonfunctional tests in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI
value.excerpt: Azure Batch is an Azure service that enables you to run large-scale parallel and high-performance computing (HPC) applications efficiently in the cloud. There's no need to manage or configure infrastructure. Just schedule the job, allocate the resources you need, and let Batch take care of the rest.

images.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI

value.title: Run a background task in an App Service Web App with WebJobs
value.excerpt: Automate a task for a Web App that should run in the background without affecting the performance of the Web App.

images.title: Run a background task in an App Service Web App with WebJobs

value.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
value.excerpt: SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non-shared host/server bare-metal hardware.

images.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage

value.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework
value.excerpt: Add authentication and authorization to an ASP.NET Core web app using the Identity framework.

images.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework

value.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
value.excerpt: Create an application that that uses an Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database. Store, retrieve and manipulate graph data and visualize it using Data Explorer.

images.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API

value.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data
value.excerpt: Use unsupervised learning methods to predict groupings in data. Use variations of k-means clustering and spectral clustering to analyze and visualize difficult data sets.

images.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data

value.title: Upload data to Azure Data Lake Storage
value.excerpt: Learn various ways to upload data to Data Lake Storage Gen 2. Upload data through the Azure portal, Azure Storage Explorer, or .NET. Or copy the data in Azure Data Factory.

images.title: Upload data to Azure Data Lake Storage

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure. You will explore relational data offerings, provisioning and deploying relational databases, and querying relational data through cloud data solutions with Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Explore relational data offerings in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Explore Azure SQL Database, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Database for MySQL, and Azure Database for MariaDB. Explore scenarios for using these database management systems.

images.title: Explore relational data offerings in Azure

topItems.title: Explore provisioning and deploying relational database offerings in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provision and configure Azure SQL Database, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, and Azure Database for MySQL.

images.title: Explore provisioning and deploying relational database offerings in Azure

topItems.title: Query relational data in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Structured Query Language (SQL), and how you can use it to query, insert, update, and delete data in a relational database.

images.title: Query relational data in Azure
Explore relational data offerings in Azure

value.title: Identify principles and practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: It is imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in business. In this learning path, you will be provided with guidelines to assist in setting up principles and a governance model in your organization. You will also be provided with resources, best practices, and tools.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we’ve recognized six principles that we believe should guide AI development and use — fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability. For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, it’s imperative that organizations have governing practices in place to ensure that it’s used responsibly. Responsible use of AI starts with organizations establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every organization will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but we’re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as others embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we don’t have all the answers, we’d like to share what we’ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Plan and implement data platform resources
value.excerpt: Deploy data platform resources in Azure for SQL Server and Open Source databases. Explore options for upgrade and migration.  Calculate resource requirements and create templates.

topItems.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
topItems.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

topItems.title: Deploy MariaDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Compare Open Source Azure Database offerings with Azure SQL Server offerings. Configure an Open Source database and configure high availability and security options.
